task.summary: Default task
Added JUnit5 as a Maven dependency
Created test class ColourTest.java inside new package com.example.demo
Created test method testColour and generated the new class to be tested Colour.java using Intellij
Input 3 double values into test constructor which caused the test to fail. Added 3 input paramaters to the constructor to make the test pass
Refactored variable names in Colour constructor to be more descriptive
Created test method for getter for red value in ColourTest.java. Then generated getRed method to be tested in Colour.java
Caused assertion to succeed by assigning red value in constructor and returning red variable in getter
Created test method for getter for green value in ColourTest.java. Then generated getGreen method to be tested in Colour.java
Created assert to test that inputted value for green is equal to value inputted to constructor for green. The assert fails
Caused assertion to pass by assigning green value in constructor and returning green variable in getter
Created test method for getter for blue value in ColourTest.java. Then generated getBlue method to be tested in Colour.java

Created assert to test that inputted value for blue is equal to value inputted to constructor for blue. The assert fails.Caused assertion to pass by assigning blue value in constructor and returning blue variable in getter
Created test constructor in ColourTest.java to test new constructor which takes in a 24 character long binary sequence. Then generated that constructor in Colour.java
Renamed testColour to testColourConstructor1 and made new test method testColourConstructor2. Moved tests for the second constructor to testColourConstructor2 to make the test file neater

Created assert to test if value of the first 8 digits of the binary sequence which represented red value was equal to the value the getter returned for colourTester2. Used parseInt function imported from Integer class to turn 8 digit binary into a number. The assert failed
Caused the assert to succeed by using substring and parseInt in the second constructor to extract and calculate the value of the binary sequence and made that value equal to red
Created assert to test if value of the middle 8 digits of the binary sequence which represented the green value was equal to the value the getter returned for colourTester2.The assert failed

Caused the assert to succeed by using a for loop to repeat the process used to calculate reds value and added the result to an array the values of which were then used to assign red and green respectively
Created assert to test if value of the last 8 digits of the binary sequence which represented the blue value was equal to the value the getter returned for colourTester2.The assert failed
Caused the assert to succeed by adding the last 8 digits to the for loop used to calculate red and green and then assigned the value calculated to blue
Refactored s string variable in the second constructor to rgbValue to make it more descriptive
Created new test method testColourEqualsMethod. Created assert to test that 2 colours with the same values were equal. The assert failed
Changed assertTrue to assertSame in line 38 as according to Intellij it is a simpler way of doing the assert.
Caused assert to pass by creating equals method in colour which compares based on values and not reference
Created another assert to check if 2 instance of Colour.java with different values would return false when inputted to equals. The assert succeeded
Created new test method testColourInputs to test if values which shouldn't be allowed in Colour would be rejected
Created new instance of Colour in testColourInputs to test if values for red, blue and green not between 0 and 1 would be rejected and created an assert to check this. The assert failed
Fixed failing assert by adding exception handling in first constructor for if values are not between 0 and 1. Now the programme does not allow you to initaliase values if they are not allowed
Tested if programme rejects binary input longer than 24 characters which it should. It did not reject it
Fixed programme to reject binary sequence if its not 24 character by adding exception handling in try catch block
Fixed exception handling to throw exceptions rather than printing out messages to the screen and exiting
Added exception handling in case 24 digit rgb value was not in binary and threw IllegalArgumentException if it was not.
Altered constructors to take in inputs as float rather than as doubles so they did not need to be cast in Colour.java
Created test for setRed in ColourTest and then generated method to be tested in Colour
Created assert to test that redValue was equal to the inputted value to setRed. The assert failed
Caused assert to succeed by assigning the inputted variable to the red value in Colour. Also added exception handling for illegal values.
Created test for setGreen and setBlue in ColourTest and then generated methods to be tested in Colour
Created assert to test that greenValue and blueValue was equal to the inputted value into setGreen and setBlue. The assert failed
Caused asserts to succeed by assigning the inputted variable to the green and blue value in Colour. Also added exception handling for illegal values.
Created test for setRed, setGreen and setBlue for the second constructor in ColourTest and then generated methods to be tested in Colour
Created assert to test that redValue greenValue and blueValue were equal to the inputted value into setGreen and setBlue for the second constructor. The asserts failed
Caused asserts to pass by having binary values being changed to floats and and then assigned in their respective setters
Refactored variables in setters in Colour to have more descriptive names
Changed access modifiers for variables in Colour to private.
Added Javadoc to Colour.java
